column4: abarbaccia-> how do you know it connects to the AP? what command you used?
it gets an ip address and everything
sorry. its all coming from the netapplet. its able to pull an IP correctly. I can post those that you wanted in a minute
here's the network command outputs: http://paste.ubuntu.com/78405/
i can connect to my wireless network, but no internet
not even internal stuff (like accessing the AP config pages)
ignore all the others, they're disabled while i test. only ath0. right now i needed to run a wire to do some debug and get online
don't ignore then, just know that they are usually disconnected and not enabled. i enabled one of them so i can get online right now and debug
i dont understand. this is the same config i've always used. ubuntu updated and i rebooted now it does not work. i plugged in a wire to my AP so i can get online
how is this not accurate - its the exact output of what you told me to run.
if you need more information about my setup i can tell you

there are two wired cards (eth0 and eth1) and one wireless card (ath0). I use the wireless card to connect to the internet and the wired cards are disconnected. Currently, for debug only, I have connected a wire to eth0 so I can get online and hoepfully debug / fix this problem
when i plug in a wire, i do not change any of the settings, it just flips over to using that instead of using the wireless.
usually there are wired cards do not have a wire plugged into them. for debug only i plugged a wire into one of them so i can get online.

i usually do. i usually only use ath0 (wireless). Now wireless stopped working. To answer your question - when i make changes and test (unplug the wire) it would have to take ath0 because there is no connection for eth0 and eth1
ath0 pulls an IP from the AP successfully. When i try to ping or get on the internet it cannot resolve.
i don't know for sure. things got a little confusing since netapplet
suffer... haha - then lets start going with the advice part
